data.title: Here are 5 MA athletes who have won gold at the Olympics. Do you remember them all?
data.meta_description: One of them famously attempted to steal an Olympic flag in a fit of excitement.
data.text:
The 2024 summer Olympics are less than a week away. Soon all eyes will turn to Paris as athletes will gather to either make their name or defend their status from all over the world.

Whether or not you care for the sport in question, there's always a special thrill when you learn that your hometown or state is being represented on the world stage. For that moment thousands of people hear your town's name. Granted, they'll forget it in the next three seconds, but it's there!

So, what about our little corner of the world? Has Massachusetts produced any gold ranking Olympians?

Of course. Here are five athletes from the state you have stood on the top of the podium in past games.

Gold Medalists from Massachusetts

Aly Raisman, Needham

Raisman took home two gold medals in the 2012 London games in gymnastics. She became the first U.S. woman to win a gold medal on for the floor exercise. She also won a gold medal in the team event when she returned for the 2016 games in Brazil. In total, she has six medal, three gold, two silver and one bronze.

David Browning, Boston

Browning won the gold for men’s springboard diving in the 1952 Helsinki games. Perhaps even more memorable that his medal, he famously attempted to steal an Olympic flag in a fit of excitement.

Richard Johnson, Worcester

Johnson won a gold medal as a member of the U.S. team at the 1996 Olympics in Atlanta. He's a five-time Olympic archer who competed in every Summer Olympic Games from 1992 to 2008. He was born in Worcester, growing up in nearby Webster, but spend most of his life in Connecticut.

Jayson Tatum

Jayson Tatum might not have been born in Massachusetts, but as one of the stars of the Celtics, we're claiming him. In the 2020 games, he was part of the men's basketball team that clinched a gold medal.

Tim Daggett

From Western Massachusetts, Tim Daggett was part of the gold medal-winning men’s Olympic Team in 1984 at the Los Angeles games. Memorably, he scored a perfect 10.0 on the horizontal bar, which was a key part of the team winning that gold medal. To this day, he's involved in the sport through his own gym and as an Olympic commentator for NBC. You'll hear him at the games this year.

Massachusetts athletes competing in Paris 2024

Here are some of the Massachusetts residents to watch for next week in Paris representing the Bay State.

Stephen Nedoroscik - Grew up in Worcester and competing in the gymnastics on the pommel horse.

Fred Richard - From Stoughton, competing in gymnastics. Richard won the Olympic trials.

Jennifer Mucino Fernandez - Boston native competing in archery

Jayson Tatum, Tremont Waters, and Derrick White - Play for the Boston Celtics, competing in basketball.

Eli Dershwitz - Grew up in Sherborn and competing in fencing (sabre).

Ally Hammel - Grew up in Duxbury, competing in field hockey.

Stephen Nedoroscik - Grew up in Worcester and competing in the gymnastics on the pommel horse.

Kristi Wagner-From Weston, competing in rowing. It's here second Olympic games.

Margaret Hedeman - From Boston, competing in rowing

Henry Hollingsworth - From Dover, competing in rowing.

Ruby Remati - From Andover, competing in Olympic swimming

Kristi Kirshe - From Franklin, competing in rugby
